TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DownloadManager extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: The download manager is a system service that handles long-running HTTP downloads.

remarks.para:
The download manager is a system service that handles long-running HTTP downloads. Clients may request that a URI be downloaded to a particular destination file. The download manager will conduct the download in the background, taking care of HTTP interactions and retrying downloads after failures or across connectivity changes and system reboots.
Instances of this class should be obtained through by passing .
Apps that request downloads through this API should register a broadcast receiver for to appropriately handle when the user clicks on a running download in a notification or from the downloads UI.
Note that the application must have the permission to use this class.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual long AddCompletedDownload (string title, string description, bool isMediaScannerScannable, string mimeType, string path, long length, bool showNotification);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int64 AddCompletedDownload(string title, string description, bool isMediaScannerScannable, string mimeType, string path, int64 length, bool showNotification) cil managed

Docs.param: the title that would appear for this file in Downloads App.
the description that would appear for this file in Downloads App.
true if the file is to be scanned by MediaScanner. Files scanned by MediaScanner appear in the applications used to view media (for example, Gallery app).

absolute pathname to the file. The file should be world-readable, so that it can be managed by the Downloads App and any other app that is used to read it (for example, Gallery app to display the file, if the file contents represent a video/image).
true if a notification is to be sent, false otherwise
Docs.summary: Adds a file to the downloads database system, so it could appear in Downloads App (and thus become eligible for management by the Downloads App).

remarks.para: Adds a file to the downloads database system, so it could appear in Downloads App (and thus become eligible for management by the Downloads App).

It is helpful to make the file scannable by MediaScanner by setting the param isMediaScannerScannable to true. It makes the file visible in media managing applications such as Gallery App, which could be a useful purpose of using this API.

a.href: http://developer.android.com/reference/android/app/DownloadManager.html#addCompletedDownload(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, boolean, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, long, boolean)

Docs.summary: Number of bytes download so far.

remarks.para: Number of bytes download so far.

Docs.summary: The client-supplied description of this download.

remarks.para: The client-supplied description of this download. This will be displayed in system notifications. Defaults to the empty string.

Docs.summary: An identifier for a particular download, unique across the system.

remarks.para: An identifier for a particular download, unique across the system. Clients use this ID to make subsequent calls related to the download.

Docs.summary: Timestamp when the download was last modified, in (wall clock time in UTC).

remarks.para: Timestamp when the download was last modified, in (wall clock time in UTC).

Docs.summary: The pathname of the file where the download is stored.

remarks.para: The pathname of the file where the download is stored.

Docs.summary: Uri where downloaded file will be stored.

remarks.para: Uri where downloaded file will be stored. If a destination is supplied by client, that URI will be used here. Otherwise, the value will initially be null and will be filled in with a generated URI once the download has started.

Docs.summary: The URI to the corresponding entry in MediaProvider for this downloaded entry.

remarks.para: The URI to the corresponding entry in MediaProvider for this downloaded entry. It is used to delete the entries from MediaProvider database when it is deleted from the downloaded list.

Docs.summary: Internet Media Type of the downloaded file.

remarks.para: Internet Media Type of the downloaded file. If no value is provided upon creation, this will initially be null and will be filled in based on the server's response once the download has started.

Docs.summary: Provides more detail on the status of the download.

remarks.para:
Provides more detail on the status of the download. Its meaning depends on the value of .
When is , this indicates the type of error that occurred. If an HTTP error occurred, this will hold the HTTP status code as defined in RFC 2616. Otherwise, it will hold one of the ERROR_* constants.
When is , this indicates why the download is paused. It will hold one of the PAUSED_* constants.
If is neither nor , this column's value is undefined.

Docs.summary: Current status of the download, as one of the STATUS_* constants.

remarks.para: Current status of the download, as one of the STATUS_* constants.

Docs.summary: The client-supplied title for this download.

remarks.para: The client-supplied title for this download. This will be displayed in system notifications. Defaults to the empty string.

Docs.summary: Total size of the download in bytes.

remarks.para: Total size of the download in bytes. This will initially be -1 and will be filled in once the download starts.

Docs.summary: URI to be downloaded.

remarks.para: URI to be downloaded.

Docs.summary: Enqueue a new download.

remarks.para: Enqueue a new download. The download will start automatically once the download manager is ready to execute it and connectivity is available.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Net.Uri GetUriForDownloadedFile(int64 id) cil managed

Docs.param: the id of the downloaded file.
Docs.summary: Returns the of the given downloaded file id, if the file is downloaded successfully.

remarks.para: Returns the of the given downloaded file id, if the file is downloaded successfully. Otherwise, null is returned.
If the specified downloaded file is in external storage (for example, /sdcard dir), then it is assumed to be safe for anyone to read and the returned corresponds to the filepath on sdcard.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
